summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General Investigations Division transcription request form for audio recordings related to case number 2019010614. The form lists names and terms relevant to the recordings, including Jeffrey Epstein and the Metropolitan Correctional Center, and was approved for processing.

events.title: Audio Interview Recording
events.description: An audio interview was conducted, lasting 1 hour, 7 minutes, and 8 seconds, which is the subject of this transcription request.

events.title: Transcription Request Approval
events.description: A DOJ OIG Investigations Division supervisor approved a request to transcribe audio recordings related to case 2019010614.

keyFacts: The document is a formal DOJ OIG request to transcribe audio recordings from an investigation under case number 2019010614.
Jeffrey Epstein is listed among the 'Names and Unfamiliar Terms' for the recordings, directly linking the audio content to him.
The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) is listed, which is the federal jail where Jeffrey Epstein died.
The form indicates an audio interview was recorded on April 7, 2022, suggesting investigative activity continued years after Epstein's death.
The form was approved by supervisor Dennis Matulewicz on April 12, 2022, for a standard 10-business-day turnaround.
